The patient is a female in her 30s with clinical stage IV invasive mammary carcinoma (IMC), no special type (NST), intermediate grade, low proliferative rate, ER/PR-negative, HER2-positive, with lymphovascular invasion (LVI), right axillary lymphadenopathy, and liver metastases, diagnosed on 04-22-2015. Initial symptoms included a persistent right breast lump noted in 09-2014, with subsequent imaging and biopsy confirming malignancy. A metastatic wor...
